text: Oh my god. I finally sent my revised paper to my advisor. It is probably going to come back for more work but having it off my desk is very well for me. I hadn’t wake up without a terrible worry for months. This paper has become an huge emotional burden for me (it is the first one). At times the only thing I want is to not see it anymore ever.

text: If it's any help, it's a bit of roller coaster ride between this step, making the paper public, sending it our for review, etc. Prepare for the ups and downs. The good news is that it eventually does end :slightly_smiling_face:.

elements.text: If it's any help, it's a bit of roller coaster ride between this step, making the paper public, sending it our for review, etc. Prepare for the ups and downs. The good news is that it eventually does end

text: Good luck <@UEGRU91B2>. That's an understandable feeling.

Yes, I am already familiar with the roller coaster, it got two revisions before being angrily rejected by an infamous researcher, then in the new journal it got some extra revisions that have extended for a year. Lately I ave been feeling that I am not working for interest or curiosity, but to satisfy these reviewers. I am starting my third year working on it.
